title: 108_hr3495
content: Section 629 of the Robert T. Stafford Disaster Relief and Emergency Assistance Act is amended to establish an Emergency Preparedness Demonstration Program to assist disadvantaged communities. The Director will establish an emergency preparedness demonstration program to support disadvantaged communities in conducting research and promoting awareness education on emergency preparedness. Grants, contracts, or cooperative agreements will be provided to eligible nonprofit organizations for this purpose. Activities supported include researching emergency preparedness status in households of disadvantaged individuals and developing culturally competent educational materials for dissemination. The program aims to provide grants to eligible nonprofit organizations to conduct research and create culturally competent educational materials on emergency preparedness for disadvantaged communities. Organizations must demonstrate a partnership with a disadvantaged business enterprise to qualify for funding. The program provides grants for research and educational materials on emergency preparedness in disadvantaged communities, including African American and Hispanic communities. It also involves partnerships with national organizations, higher education institutions, and faith-based organizations to disseminate information. Additionally, joint projects are implemented with institutions serving disadvantaged individuals. The program offers grants for research and educational materials on emergency preparedness in disadvantaged communities, including African American and Hispanic communities. To be eligible for funding, organizations must submit an application with required information. Definitions for terms like disadvantaged business enterprise, disadvantaged community, and disadvantaged individual are provided in the section. The curr_chunk defines terms like "individual" and "HUBZone" as per the Small Business Act. It also authorizes appropriations for fiscal years 2004 through 2007.
